issues.title: Exclude tests for J2ME/CDC/Foundation platform
starting an XA transaction resets the isolation level set with SET CURRENT ISOLATION
documentation need to be modified to reflect the derby-390 fix(once it is committed) ,  schem , table , column names need to be in case-sensitive form.
jdbcapi/checkDataSource.java and  jdbapi/checkDataSource30.java to tests should be changed or extended to test client DataSources
Update triggers on tables with blob columns stream blobs into memory even when the blobs are not referenced/accessed.
Handle OutOfMemoryError exceptions when creating a new embedded connection
Fix Error message X0X07 in doc to match string changes in code
Protocol exception when Network Server tries to return ~32K of data or greater in a result set for a Java stored procedure.
Add jdk14 suite to network server tests
Documentation will require changes once dynamic parameters are supported for unary minus and unary plus.
Update documentation with correct default values for network server properties
Initialize parameters within activation without using generated code.
Reduce generated code required to access a parameter's value
Have BCMethod.cast() optimize the case when the requested cast is to the same Java type.
Use a single result BooleanDataValue for a boolean expression in class generation
Improve code generation to handle 5000 unions in a select the  union test  in largeCodeGen
Document restrictions mentioned in DERBY-438
Return better error messages for the scenarios in DERBY-438
Handle pushing IN predicates into UNIONs. This would allow use of index if present improving performance.
Clean up code relating to Object handling in DataValueDescriptor.
Push join predicates into union and other set operations. DERBY-649 implemented scalar (single table) predicate pushdown. Adding join predicate push down could improve performance significantly.
Prevent unneeded object creation and excessive decoding in parsePKGNAMCSN()
Provide JDBC4 SQLException subclasses support in Embedded driver
Minor patches to client/net/(Reply|Request).java to use System.arrayCopy and java.util.Arrays
